news.title: Deep inside U.S. economy, more sticker prices start going up due to tariffs, and inventory is headed down
news.summary: There's a widespread move to adjust prices higher due to tariffs. Across U.S. distribution networks, inside retail and manufacturing warehouses, prices are going up.

news.title: Stablecoins go mainstream: Why banks and credit card firms are issuing their own crypto tokens
news.summary: Mastercard, Visa and JPMorgan all making recent moves in the crypto token space. Stablecoins are seemingly everywhere, with Mastercard and Visa among the biggest players in the space.

news.title: How China could shut down auto factories around the world
news.summary: China dominates the world’s production and processing of rare earth elements. A sudden export restriction sent the auto industry into panic. China dominates the World's production and Processing of Rare Earth Elements.

news.title: At 20 years old, Reddit is defending its data and fighting AI with AI
news.summary: After two decades, Reddit faces the emergence of AI chatbots that threaten to inhale its vast swaths of data and siphon its users.

news.title: What we know so far about Jeff Bezos' $50 million star-studded luxury Venice wedding
news.summary: Some 200 celebrities and business elite attend. Guests include Ivanka Trump, Usher and Usher. The event was held at the Trump International Hotel in Washington, D.C.

news.title: Most American weddings are a lot more extravagant than the nuptials of Amazon’s Jeff Bezos
news.summary: Americans spend an average of $33,000 on their big day. That's equivalent to between 25% and 50% of their annual household income.

news.title: AI could wipe out entire Wall Street teams. Here’s who will have staying power.
news.summary: “The number of people used, whether it be a junior banker, analyst or a salesperson, you just don’t need to throw bodies at it anymore,” he says.

news.title: ‘I am horrified’: My company won’t allow me to tip more than 15% for Ubers. Do I explain this to the driver?
news.summary: “I would never even consider tipping less than 20% if it were a personal ride,” she says. “I’m a big fan of tipping at least 20%.”

news.title: Can a baby bonus really make Americans have more kids? Here’s what big families say.
news.summary: Large families share how they’re making it work in this economy. Up at 4:45 a.m., driving a 12-passenger van, and no big vacations.

news.title: My sister and her husband died within days of each other. Their banks won’t let me access their safe-deposit boxes. What now?
news.summary: “The bank suggested filing a claim for unclaimed property in the state where I reside,” she said. “TheBank suggested filing an unclaimedProperty claim in the State Where I reside.”
